comments.author: ngreyling
comments.snippet:
If I remember correctly, at one point in the past, Riley had made it so that if PuTTY has no saved sessions other than one called 'Default Settings' then mRemoteNG wouldn't show the 'PuTTY Saved Sessions' node at all. Perhaps at some later point this was changed again for some reason.

I too would prefer that 'PuTTY Saved Sessions' was not visible in the tree, as all it contains is 'Default Settings' which is obviously not a session that I ever connect to.

comments.author: plkdn
comments.snippet: Actually nobody needs Putty Saved Sessions  because we install MremoteNG not to use Putty in the first place
